Articles.Content:
This is one of those YT channels that deserves to be famous.

Amy Shira Teitel, the host, describes a great deal of sometimes almost obscure tidbits about spaceflight.

[link to the channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCw95T_TgbGHhTml4xZ9yIqg) ; [follow her on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/amy.teitel); [Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/#!/astvintagespace)

For example, did you know a realistic size mockup of Saturn V was shaked by people to discover its natural swaying frequency?

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/924VfFBEgMc?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

My brother told me about that... Man that's weird stuff.

They didn't have any facility to test the loads, apparently.
KEWL! But seriously, this is pretty nice info. I see why you think the channel this comes from deserves more popularity.

She did a KSP video!

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O0fKqaNyzBQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> She did a KSP video!
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O0fKqaNyzBQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

You and just made my day.

I drew this a while ago.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/O0fKqaNyzBQ?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Saw this today.
